elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Are absolute or relative rights affected in the following examples? Give reasons.

elements.name: Frage 2
elements.title: Her salary is CHF 900 according to her apprenticeship contract.
elements.correctAnswer: You can only demand wages from your employer, so the right to wages is a relative right.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Your cell phone is stolen.
elements.correctAnswer: Everyone must respect your ownership of your cell phone. The thief is therefore violating an absolute right.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: You must pay your cell phone bill of CHF 50.
elements.correctAnswer: The telephone company can only demand payment of the bill from you, so it only has a relative right.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: You have written a poem. Your colleague prints the poem in the school newspaper without your knowledge.
elements.correctAnswer: Your colleague is violating an absolute right, namely your copyright to the poem.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Are absolute or relative rights affected in the following examples? Give reasons.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Unknown persons spray-paint the facade of the school building.
elements.correctAnswer: The sprayers are violating the school's property rights, which is an absolute right.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: In sports class, a teammate fouls you roughly. You fall and break your arm.
elements.correctAnswer: Your right to physical integrity applies to everyone. Your teammate has therefore violated an absolute right.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Your doctor will send you the invoice for the treatment of the broken arm.
elements.correctAnswer: You have ordered the treatment. The doctor can only demand payment of the bill from you and not from your fellow patient. The doctor therefore only has a relative right.
